probability.name: MATH 102: Probability
probability.text: Covers probability, random variables, expectation, probability distributions and hypothesis testing.

programming.name: CS 101: Programming
programming.text: Teaches the basics of programming, using the C language as an example.

math-for-cs.name: CS 201: Math for computer science
math-for-cs.text: Covers mathematical topics frequently encountered in computer science, like proofs, combinatorics, recurrence relations, graph theory and probability.

software-dev.name: CS 203: Software development
software-dev.text: Teaches elements of robust, professional software development.

edges.text: Probability is required to study random processes.
The practical component of DSA studies how to implement data structures and algorithms as programs.
For proving correctness of algorithms and analyzing their running time.
Probability is required to analyze randomized algorithms.
